docs.snippet: The United States transport Illinois, WM. RATHBUN, Commander, arrived at this port Thursday morning, from Port Royal, S.C., having sailed from thence on the 25th, at 4:20 P.M., making the run in 59 hours. She brings a mail and 74 passengers.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM PORT ROYAL; ARRIVAL OF THE STEAM TRANSPORT ILLINOIS. Tybee Island, at the Mouth of the Savannah River, in Possession of our Troops. Probable Demonstration Against the Rear of Fort Pulaski. Another Expedition Fitting Out at Port Royal. ITS DESTINATION SOME POINT FURTHER SOUTH Beaufort Still Unoccupied Two Gunboats Keeping Watch. LARGE QUANTITIES OF COTTON FOUND. Great Influx of Negroes Their Joy at Their Change of Life. A Union Sentiment in South Carolina. Rebel Prisoners Brought to this Port.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States transport Illinois, WM. RATHBUN, Commander, arrived at this port Thursday morning, from Port Royal, S.C., having sailed from thence on the 25th, at 4:20 P.M., making the run in 59 hours. She brings a mail and 74 passengers.

docs.snippet: This discourse was founded on I. Thess. v. 18: "In everything give thanks." He remarked in the introduction that true gratitude is to be always exercised; that there are no possible circumstances, however afflictive, in which we may not find grounds...

headline.main: SERMON BY REV. DR. ASA D. SMITH.; FOURTEENTH-STREET PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH.

docs.lead_paragraph: This discourse was founded on I. Thess. v. 18: "In everything give thanks." He remarked in the introduction that true gratitude is to be always exercised; that there are no possible circumstances, however afflictive, in which we may not find grounds for it.

docs.snippet: Rev. Dr. CHAPIN preached from the following text:  "But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come."  Mark, iv., 29.

headline.main: SERMON BY REV. DR. E.H. CHAPIN.; FOURTH UNIVERSALIST CHURCH.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rev. Dr. CHAPIN preached from the following text: "But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come." Mark, iv., 29.

headline.main: A LETTER FROM COL. LEE.; THE QUESTION OF THE EXCHANGE OF PRISONERS.

docs.snippet: The dinner given by the merchants and other citizens of Boston to Capt. WILKES, U.S.N., took place last evening.
